Package user.speaker

Class SpeakerPresenter

  • java.lang.Object
    • user.UserPresenter
      • user.speaker.SpeakerPresenter
  • public class SpeakerPresenter
extends UserPresenter
    This class is a Presenter Class with specific functionality for Speaker Controllers. It handles asking for user input and printing any error messages.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SpeakerPresenter()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void displayAllEventsGiven​(java.util.List<Event> events)
      Prints all events that a Speaker is speaking at.
      void displayAllFutureEventsGiving​(java.util.List<Event> events)
      Prints all future events which this Speaker is attending.
      void displayEnterAttendeeUsernamePrompt()
      Asks the name of the attendee that you are replying to
      void displayEnterEventNamePrompt()
      Asks the name of the first event whose attendees you'd like to message
      void displayEnterEventNamePrompt2()
      Asks the name of all other events (not the first one) whose attendees you'd like to message
      void displayEnterMessagePrompt()
      Asks for the content of the message to be sent
      void displayEnterNumberOfEventsPrompt()
      Asks how many events' attendees you'd like to message
      void displayEventAlreadyAddedError()
      Prints that the Speaker has already selected this event's attendees to be messaged
      void displayEventAttendeesList​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> eventAttendees)
      Prints the set of all users attending an event.
      void displayEventNotGivenError()
      Prints that the Speaker hasn't given the named event
      void displayEventSelectorPrompt()
      Prints the message that asks the user which attendee they want to message.
      void displayInvalidDateError()
      Prints the message the date input is invalid.
      void displayNotSpeakerError()
      Prints the message that the user input is not a speaker.
      void displayNumberOfEventsError()
      Asks how many events' attendees you'd like to message
      void displayOptions3()
      Prints all the tasks which a Speaker can do.
